list_definition.definition: (a country etc that has) government by a monarch

list_ex_of_english: One of the most str iking differences between pre- and postwar monarchies is the way in which royal mar r iages took place.
Succession crises can provide a possible path toward democratization from authoritarian monarchies.
The ability of regimes to control smaller populations better deserves to be further explored in relation to the survival of authoritarian monarchies.
After all, there are quite a number of countries which still have hereditary monarchies.
From the vantage point of three decades ago, monarchies were an endangered species.
There was no obvious role for them in new nation-states and in many dependencies indigenous monarchies were swept aside by the onrush of nationalism.
I believe most fervently that the history of the two great old monarchies has reached a watershed.
The monarchies that failed to survive could not incorporate the growth of the new middle class.
